title: Your probate application
block1Heading2: Post your documents to the probate registry
block1Text1: Print off this cover letter to include with your documents.
block1Text2: If you do not have access to a printer, include your reference number {ccdReferenceNumber} on a sheet of paper and include it with your documents.
block1Text3: You’ll need to include a cover letter if the will or codicils have changed in any way since you’ve had them.
block1Text4: The letter should explain whats been changed and why.
block1Text5: You should send your documents using a signed-for postal service to:
block1Text6: The grant of probate won’t be issued if you don’t have all the necessary documents.
block1Checklist1-item1-no-codicils: the original will (this won’t be returned to you)
block1Checklist1-item1-codicils: the original will and any updates (codicils) (these won’t be returned to you)
block1Checklist2-item3-will-uploaded: the original death certificate (this will be returned to you)
block1Checklist2-item4-iht205: the completed inheritance tax form IHT 205
block1Checklist2-item5-renunciated: a renunciation form filled in by any executors who are permanently giving up their right to make this application for probate
block1Checklist2-item6-deed-poll: copy of the deed poll document for {executorCurrentName}
block2Text1: Your application will be processed as soon as the Probate Registry receives your documents.
block2Text2: You will receive the grant of probate and any copies you’ve ordered within 20 working days of your documents being received.
block2Text3: We’ll email you if we need any more information. You can also call the Probate Registry on {helpLineNumber} if you have any questions.
block2Text4: Find out what to do when you receive your grant of probate.
